news.title: Trichy’s luxury flat boom finds ready buyers
news.para: Trichy's real estate market is experiencing a boom, with premium flat prices soaring to over Rs 1.5 crore, surpassing some Chennai areas. This surge is attributed to infrastructure development and increased demand for larger, amenity-rich homes. Developers anticipate further growth with upcoming tech parks and hospitals.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: Residents accuse developer of encroaching upon common road
news.para: Residents of a GGP Colony housing project are accusing their developer of encroaching on common roads for a new project, causing safety hazards. They also claim the developer has occupied common areas within their complex for unauthorized commercial use. Despite multiple complaints and favorable rulings from authorities, residents express deep disappointment over the government's inaction.

news.title: Reforming land policies can make housing more affordable: Niti Aayog member
news.para: According to Niti Aayog, escalating land prices pose significant challenges for housing developments. Proposed reforms aim to reduce these expenses and enhance housing availability. Under the PMAY initiative, the government has approved millions of housing units. Initiatives are in motion to amplify credit flow, making homes more accessible to every citizen.

news.title: Odisha to introduce QR codes on land ownership documents for instant verification
news.para: Odisha is set to revolutionize land ownership with QR-coded land documents. Buyers and officials can instantly verify ownership history, location, and transaction details, extending beyond the current 30-year limit. This digital upgrade aims to prevent fraud, reduce litigation, and enhance transparency in land dealings across the state.

news.title: DDA issues notice to re-acquire 123 disputed land plots in South Delhi
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) will re-acquire 123 land parcels in South Delhi villages following Supreme Court directives. This move aims to prevent unsuspecting buyers from purchasing plots embroiled in legal disputes. The DDA has uploaded details of these parcels, originally acquired in the 1980s, on its website and cautions against any transactions.

news.title: Telangana RERA orders Bhuvanteza Infra Project to pay penalty for selling flats without authority
news.para: Telangana RERA has fined Bhuvanteza Infra Project Private Limited ₹43.7 lakh for allotting units without legal authority in its 'Tulasi Lake Front' project. The developer committed statutory violations, including misrepresenting ownership and collecting payments without authorization. This penalty follows an earlier order for a full refund with interest due to the allotment of units in an unregistered project component.

news.title: Bombay HC upholds deemed conveyance to commercial cooperative society over builder contract rights
news.para: The Bombay High Court has upheld a deemed conveyance granted to a cooperative housing society, ruling that a builder cannot override public interest laws with private contracts. The court emphasized that a builder's contractual rights to further development do not supersede the statutory duty to convey property to flat purchasers once construction is complete and all FSI is utilized.

news.title: Gurugram naib tehsildar under lens for allegedly registering deeds linked to Ansal Buildwell despite ban
news.para: A naib tehsildar in Gurgaon, already suspended for a hotel registry controversy, is now under scrutiny for allegedly registering multiple conveyance deeds linked to Ansal Buildwell despite a DTCP ban. This has triggered a broader review of registries in Wazirabad and Badshahpur tehsils, with authorities questioning how public utility sites were exchanged and if planning norms were bypassed.

news.title: Mumbai's civic body initiates e-auction of six properties over ₹455.48 crore tax dues
news.para: Mumbai's civic body has begun e-auction proceedings for six properties. These properties owe Rs 455.48 crore in property tax.  Final notices have also been issued to two other defaulters.  This action is part of a special drive against major tax defaulters.  The civic body is attaching movable assets first, then immovable property if dues remain unrecovered.

news.title: Washington DC sues landlords with law used in organized crime to stop mistreatment of low-income tenants
news.para: Washington D.C. is applying the RICO statute in a housing lawsuit for the very first time. Attorney General Brian Schwalb is taking aim at landlords whose substandard conditions have put tenants at risk. This legal challenge looks to dismantle a real estate network that supposedly deceived investors while misusing affordable housing aid.

news.title: ED arrests ex-director of Lodha Developers in ₹85 crore money laundering case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has taken into custody a former director of Lodha Developers over serious allegations of money laundering. The scandal revolves around Rs 85 crore, with investigations uncovering a web of unauthorized transactions and misappropriated company funds. Evidence suggests that fake land possession claims and forged contracts were instrumental in the deceit.

news.title: Shriram Properties resolves Kolkata land issues with West Bengal government
news.para: Shriram Properties has resolved a long-standing commercial dispute with the West Bengal government. The company conveyed 42.37 acres of land at Uttarpara, fulfilling its obligations. It plans to develop five to six million sq ft of new projects in Kolkata over the next five years. These projects have a potential gross development value of ₹3,000 crore.

news.title: Puravankara posts net profit of ₹58.34 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Puravankara  reported a net profit of ₹58.34 crore for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. This marks a substantial improvement from the ₹92.64 crore loss recorded in the same period last year. Total income also saw a sharp rise to ₹1,104.06 crore.

news.title: RERA doing nothing except facilitating defaulting builders: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has questioned the effectiveness of Real Estate Regulatory Authorities across India. Justices expressed disappointment, stating these bodies primarily aid defaulting builders. The court suggested states reconsider the very existence of these authorities. This observation came as the court allowed Himachal Pradesh to relocate its RERA office.

news.title: Experion Developers to invest ₹1,500 crore to develop residential project in Noida
news.para: Experion Developers is set to invest ₹1,500 crore in a new residential project named SAATORI in Noida's Sector 151. The project will span five acres and feature three towers, with one dedicated to 4BHK residences.  Singapore and Plandscape Bangkok are the architectural and landscape consultants respectively.

news.title: Exotica Housing to invest ₹500 crore to develop Noida project
news.para: Exotica Housing will invest ₹500 crore in its new IT and ITES project, Exotica One32, in Noida's Sector 132. The project spans five acres with two 27-floor towers offering office spaces from 1,000 to 3,000 sq ft. Integrated retail spaces are also part of the development. Phase-I possession is expected by January 2030.

news.title: DevX inks record coworking deal, takes 27-storey Ahmedabad office tower
news.para: Dev Accelerator has secured a massive 27-storey office tower in Ahmedabad. This deal, valued at over Rs 850 crore, is the largest coworking transaction in India. The agreement is structured as a development management deal. The project is currently under construction and will be ready in about 2.5 to three years.

news.title: First in Andhra Pradesh, Visakhapatnam to get slum rehabilitation authority
news.para: Andhra Pradesh's Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation is establishing a Slum Rehabilitation Authority to redevelop Velampeta and Indira Gandhi Nagar. These pilot projects will transform slums into high-rise apartments through public-private partnerships, offering free housing to beneficiaries and incentivizing developers with TDR and FSI benefits.

news.title: Maharashtra cabinet nod to raise ₹6,000 crore loan for Purandar airport land acquisition
news.para: The Maharashtra government has approved a Rs 6,000 crore loan to acquire land for the Purandar airport project. A special purpose vehicle, with CIDCO holding the majority stake, will manage the greenfield airport's execution. This project is expected to significantly boost development and connectivity in Pune and western Maharashtra.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh budget earmarks ₹750 crore for Noida airport
news.para: Of the total allocation, Rs 750 crore has been allocated for the development of the Noida International Airport in Jewar area of Gautam Buddha Nagar district. The first phase of the airport is being developed in public-private partnership mode.
